thread.title: Woman's four-year-old son saves her life with 999 call after terrifying seizures
thread.title_full: Woman's four-year-old son saves her life with 999 call after terrifying seizures

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Woman's four-year-old son saves her life with 999 call after terrifying seizures
text:
My four year old son saved my life! (Photo: Copyright unknown) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A woman told ITV's This Morning about the amazing moment her brave son saved her life with a 999 call. 
Speaking to hosts Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughy, proud mum Gemma revealed how her 4-year-old boy Jacob's quick thinking meant she survived after collapsing from a seizure at their home. 
"I didn't know anything until Jacob brought me around," she explained of the moment her young son dialed 999 after seeing his mum unconscious on the ground, telling the operator she wasn't talking. Gemma's boy saved her life (Photo: ITV) The brave four-year-old called 999 (Photo: ITV) Everyone on the sofa praised Jacob (Photo: ITV) 
"I couldnâ€™t remember even talking to the operator. It was that bad, it was so upsetting hearing him... he's an amazing boy." 
Her brave boy's quick thinking was even more impressive given his own speech problems - but he still called to help save his mum. Phillip took him to watch the boats (Photo: ITV) They gave him a wonderful toy digger (Photo: ITV) He looked delighted with the surprise (Photo: ITV) 
Little Jacob was brought into the studio during his mum's interview, and quickly went over to the window with Phil to look at the boats on the River Thames. 
There was a lovely surprise for the young hero too, who was given a present by the host - a huge toy digger. 
He was then seen playing on the gift in the studio, as mum Gemma proudly gushed over her boy. Like us on Facebook
